com.decoded.zool

Interface ZoolDataSink

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ZoolDataFlow, ZoolWatcher
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ZoolDataFlowImpl, ZoolDataSinkImpl

    public interface ZoolDataSink
    Interface for an accepter of Zookeeper node data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ZoolDataSink disconnectWhenDataIsReceived()
      Calling this on data sink (before fetching data) will cause the data sink to disconnect when its onData handler is called.
      ZoolDataSink disconnectWhenNoDataExists()
      Calling this on a data sink (before fetching data) will cause the data sink to disconnect when its onDataNotExists handler is called.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Named datasink (useful for debugging and visualizing the flow of zookeeper data to your application).
      java.lang.String getZNode()
      The Zookeeper node name that is draining to this data sink.
      boolean isReadChildren()
      Read Children Nodes and watch for result updates
      void onChildren(java.lang.String zNode, java.util.List<java.lang.String> childNodes)
      When reading children, this will handle child node name updates.
      void onData(java.lang.String zNode, byte[] data)
      The main drain method.
      void onDataNotExists(java.lang.String zNode)
      Invoked when there is no data at the specified zNode.
      ZoolDataSink oneOff()
      Calling this on data sink has the same behavior as calling both disconnectWhenDataIsReceived and disconnectWhenNoDataExists together.
      void onNoChildren(java.lang.String zNode)
      When no children are found on the path
      ZoolDataSink setChildNodesHandler(java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> childNodesHandler)
      Set the handler for child node information
      ZoolDataSink setNoChildNodesHandler(java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.String> noChildNodesHandler)
      Set the handler for not having child node information on a path
      ZoolDataSink setReadChildren(boolean readChildren)
      Read Children Nodes and watch for result updates
      boolean willDisconnectOnData()
      If true, this data sink should be disconnected after it receives and processes data.
      boolean willDisconnectOnNoData()
      If true, this data sink should be discarded if it recieves no data.

    • Method Detail

      • setChildNodesHandler

        ZoolDataSink setChildNodesHandler(java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> childNodesHandler)
        Set the handler for child node information
        Parameters:
        childNodesHandler - the handler for children nodes.
        Returns:
        this data sink.

      • setNoChildNodesHandler

        ZoolDataSink setNoChildNodesHandler(java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.String> noChildNodesHandler)
        Set the handler for not having child node information on a path
        Parameters:
        noChildNodesHandler - the handler for no children nodes.
        Returns:
        this data sink.

      • isReadChildren

        boolean isReadChildren()
        Read Children Nodes and watch for result updates
        Returns:
        true if this data sink also wants to watch for child updates.

      • setReadChildren

        ZoolDataSink setReadChildren(boolean readChildren)
        Read Children Nodes and watch for result updates
        Parameters:
        readChildren - a flag.
        Returns:
        this data sink

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Named datasink (useful for debugging and visualizing the flow of zookeeper data to your application).
        Returns:
        a String.

      • getZNode

        java.lang.String getZNode()
        The Zookeeper node name that is draining to this data sink.
        Returns:
        a String.

      • onNoChildren

        void onNoChildren(java.lang.String zNode)
        When no children are found on the path
        Parameters:
        zNode - the path.

      • onChildren

        void onChildren(java.lang.String zNode,
                java.util.List<java.lang.String> childNodes)
        When reading children, this will handle child node name updates.
        Parameters:
        zNode - the patch that received child nodes
        childNodes - the child node names

      • onData

        void onData(java.lang.String zNode,
            byte[] data)
        The main drain method. Data recieved on the path will be directed here.
        Parameters:
        zNode - the event path (as part of zookeepers structure, this is passed in). It must be equal to the path that was assigned upon creation of the data sink, or it should not be handled by this sink.
        data - the incoming data.

      • onDataNotExists

        void onDataNotExists(java.lang.String zNode)
        Invoked when there is no data at the specified zNode.
        Parameters:
        zNode - the node path.

      • willDisconnectOnData

        boolean willDisconnectOnData()
        If true, this data sink should be disconnected after it receives and processes data.
        Returns:
        a boolean

      • willDisconnectOnNoData

        boolean willDisconnectOnNoData()
        If true, this data sink should be discarded if it recieves no data.
        Returns:
        a boolean

      • disconnectWhenNoDataExists

        ZoolDataSink disconnectWhenNoDataExists()
        Calling this on a data sink (before fetching data) will cause the data sink to disconnect when its onDataNotExists handler is called.

        This is handy for cleaning up as early as possible

        Returns:
        this data sink.

      • disconnectWhenDataIsReceived

        ZoolDataSink disconnectWhenDataIsReceived()
        Calling this on data sink (before fetching data) will cause the data sink to disconnect when its onData handler is called.
        Returns:
        this data sink.

      • oneOff

        ZoolDataSink oneOff()
        Calling this on data sink has the same behavior as calling both disconnectWhenDataIsReceived and disconnectWhenNoDataExists together.
        Returns:
        this data sink
